messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Jail
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you so much for asking. I really appreciate that. I m fine. It was almost thirteen years ago. My ex MIL is gone. Oddly, she was waked  on what would have
messages.messageBody:
Thank you so much for asking. I really appreciate that.
I'm fine.
It was almost thirteen years ago.
My ex MIL is gone. Oddly, she was waked on what would have been my 32nd wedding anniversary.

She was so horrible.
She paid.
So did her children.
Her oldest son - my ex - died at 38 (drugs)
Her oldest daughter is unhealthily obese & has raised very demanding bullies (Her son reminds me of Harry Potters' cousin!)
Her youngest son is a serial sperm donor - 5 & counting w/ no responsibility (my ex MIL knew that these girls were lying - DNA wasn't as good as her Jimmy telling her the truth)
Her youngest daughter is in assisted living - suicidal, severe depression - she's the sanest one left.

I out lived Aggie
My kids are healthy.
I'm not doing too bad.
Brianna just came in said "I love you"

As our friend says "Life is Good"

Janis
----- Original Message -----
From: KathrynJB@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, May 14, 2003 5:07 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Jail


In a message dated 5/14/2003 4:49:33 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

> I spent Easter weekend in the state prison, here in RI.
>
> My ex- MIL had my daughter arrested after we found out that there was no
> money for my kids (long story about evil people)
>
> The police had to release my kid. Then they wanted more.
> They came for me - thinking my kid would "give back" the $389,000 she took
> (she wasn't in the city!!)
>
> Anyway - Good Friday, the Police come &arrest me. My name began w/ M
> Court was adjourned at noon.
> Anyone they hadn't gotten to was sent to the prison.
>
> Guards watched us shower
> the showers had no doors
> the toilets had no doors
>
> the food was rancid
> we locked into tiny rooms w/ many other women
> the heat was turned up all the way - all the time
> the windows could only open 2"
> A guard had to open &close the windows because they were behind bars.
>
> the food was rancid
> the guards tormented us
> the guards had sex
> the guards had absolute power.
>
> You had to buy anything you needed - including soap, toothbrush, tooth
> paste, face cloths, towels
>
> This was the section called "Holding" as in for the weekend.
>
> It sucked.
>
> Janis
>

Janis, are you okay?
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
